The José Rizal Heritage Awards are administered by the José Rizal Heritage Fund and granted in accordance with the principle of "resonating with the ideals and legacy of Dr. José Rizal". The prizes were first awarded in 2023.
The first José Rizal Heritage Awards covered six fields: Statesmanship and Public Service, Humanitarian Services, Cultural and Public Services, Sustainable Economic and Public Services, Medical Research and Education, and Lifetime Achievement.
The José Rizal Heritage Award is widely regarded as a prestigious award in the respective fields especially in the Philippine community.
Except in extraordinary circumstances, such as war or pandemia, all awards are given annually. Each recipient, known as a laureate, receives a José Rizal Award Plaque and a certificate.
Since 2023, the José Rizal Heritage Awards were awarded 19 times to 21 laureates.
History
The José Rizal Heritage Fund Association was established in 2019 as a tax-exempt organization to coordinate and implement the philanthropic aid projects of the various chapters of the Knights of Rizal in Switzerland. This allows for the issuance of tax-deductible donation receipts to donors.
The Order of the Knights of Rizal is the only state-recognized order of knighthood in the Philippines. It was founded to honor and uphold the ideals of the Philippine national hero José Rizal. Membership in the order, along with its ranks and insignia, is recognized as an official honor and award under the "Honors Code of the Philippines (Executive Order No. 236)."
The order was founded on December 30, 1911 by nine founding members under the leadership of Colonel Antonio Torres, who would later become the first chief of police of Manila. In 1951 a Legislative Charter was signed into law by the then President Elpidio Quirino on June 14, 1951 as Republic Act No. 646, transforming the privately constituted order (existing since 1911) into a body corporate and politic.
Award
Since the José Rizal Heritage Fund, as a non-profit association, cannot take on any financial risks, a separate, non-charitable association to organize the José Rizal Heritage Award Gala was established. This association - José Rizal Heritage Award Organization - organized the first Award Gala on September 23, 2023, in Wil, St. Gallen, Switzerland.
Laureates
The following outstanding individuals have been honored with a José Rizal Heritage Award for their contributions to the society:
Award Winners 2024:
Humanitarian Services:
Hon. Bishop Damien Mead, United Kingdom
The Right Reverend Damien Mead is consecrated as Bishop Ordinary of the Anglican Catholic Church's Diocese of the United Kingdom since 2008. In the year 2000 his friend Roy Hipkiss and himself founded and managed the Credo Care Fostering Limited to provide foster care service for the most vulnerable children in our society. Damien and Roy were determined from the beginning to establish an Independent Fostering Agency which would offer a viable alternative to children and young people often historically overlooked by fostering providers and consigned to long term residential or hospital care.
Hon. Roy Hipkiss, United Kingdom
In the year 2000 the Hon. Roy Hipkiss and his friend The Right Reverend Damien Mead founded and managed the Credo Care Fostering Limited to provide foster care service for the most vulnerable children in our society. Damien and Roy were determined from the beginning to establish an Independent Fostering Agency which would offer a viable alternative to children and young people often historically overlooked by fostering providers and consigned to long term residential or hospital care.
Hon. Dr. Christin ter Braak-Forstinger, Switzerland
Christin is one of Europe's leading impact investing experts. She is the founder and CEO of Chi Impact Capital, an award-winning and fully independent Impact Investing Advisor based in Zurich. She is a regular key-note speaker on international Impact Investing events, a regular author to help advance the impact ecosystem and she is a long-time university lecturer for impact investing. Christin is the co-founder of the NGO Braveaurora active in the North of Ghana with a team of 15 full time people on the ground. Christin has served as the president of the NGO for more than 10 years and now chairs the Advisory Board. Braveaurora is an official collaboration partner of Unicef Ghana since 2017.
Hon. Dr. Yasmeen Lari, Pakistan
Dr. Yasmeen Lari is Pakistan's first female architect. She is best known for her involvement in the intersection of architecture and social justice. Since her official retirement from architectural practice in 2000, her UN-recognized NGO Heritage Foundation Pakistan has been taking on humanitarian relief work and historical conservation projects in rural villages all around Pakistan. She was awarded the prestigious Fukuoka Prize in 2016 and the RIBA's Royal Gold Medal in 2023.
Hon. Sohail Mirza, Switzerland
Since the Balochistan earthquake in 2013 a cooperation on various topics has envolved between the Hon. Sohail Mirza from Arlesheim and Dr. Yasmeen Lari, Pakistan's first female architect. She is best known for her involvement in the intersection of architecture and social justice. Lari designed a fuel-efficient and affordable chulah (stove) that improved on traditional stoves and did not emit toxic smoke into Pakistani homes for example. The stove design won the World Habitat award that same year. The Barefoot Social Architecture Concept unites traditional elements with modern methods in various fields.
Cultural and Public Services:
H.E. Emmanuel Bushayija
Titularking Yuhi VI. of Rwanda, United Kingdom/Rwanda
Yuhi VI., born Emmanuel Bushayija, is the claimant to the crown of the historical Kingdom of Rwanda, which was abolished in 1961. He was proclaimed the ceremonial successor to the royal title (Mwami) on 9 January 2017. He succeeded his late uncle King Kigeli V, who was the last sovereign ruler of the Kingdom of Rwanda. He grew up in exile in Uganda and also lived in Kenya, working in the tourism industry, before returning to Rwanda in July 1994 and moving to the United Kingdom six years later.
In England Yuhi VI is supporting the Heritage and Culture of the Royal House of Rwanda and is supporting his countrymen in the refugee camps at the borders to the neighboring countries.
Cultural Achievements:
Hon. Christopher P. Pelicano, Philippines
Christopher P. Pelicano was engaging in visual arts after he finished his pedagogical studies. He is a member of the Philippine Art Educators Association and was honored with several Prices for his paintings and art installations He was also selected to present 10 oversized paintings inside the highest building in Davao City, the Aeon Tower. As a well know artist from the south of the Philippines he represents the Heritage and the Openness of his home region successfully also on international level.
Hon. Primitivo Harden Posadas, Philippines
Primitivo Posadas is an autodidact painter, who is living his dream since more than 50 years to make a living for his family through painting pictures. He is working with his daily impressions that he is processing into his fantastic landscape paintings represent-ting his daily life and the culture of his home Davao del Norte. He is overly happy to receive his first award aged 74 years this year.
Sustainable Economic Development:
Hon. Bianca Cefalo, MSC, United Kingdom
Bianca Cefalo is the CEO and Co-founder of Space DOTS Inc., a UK based space tech start-up pioneering in-space testing, space environments data harvesting and in-situ quality control of advanced space materials. With an MSc in Aerospace and Astronautical Engineering, Bianca's expertise extends to Spacecraft Thermal Control Systems, Hypersonic Aerodynamics, Microgravity, and Satellite Remote Sensing. As the youngest Italian analyst and payload qualification campaign director on the NASA/JPL Insight Mars Mission in 2013, she left an indelible mark on pioneering science missions.
Hon. Parviz Pargari, KCR, Turkije/USA
Internationally acclaimed and award-winning Interior and Architectural Designer, Parviz Pargari was born in Kermanshah, Iran. He moved to Los Angeles in 1989, where he studied at California State University, Northridge. Pargari obtained a bachelor's degree in interior design, followed by a master's degree in architectural and Furniture Design. He started his career as a designer for an international company in 1998, designing furniture that was subsequently sold by major retailers. In 2002, he became the founder and president of Pargari Design International and later launched his own line of custom designed furniture. His work has been published time and again in several interior design publications. According to California Homes Magazine, â€œPargari's accomplish-ments and achievements have made him a living paradigm emulated by many, not only in the United States of America, but also in his birth country Iran, throughout Asia and the International community. Pargari has been teaching at the Fashion Institute of Design & Merchandising (FIDM) in Los Angeles.
Sustainable Economic and Public Services:
Hon. Philip D. Morais, KCR, Macau
Born and raised in Hong Kong, Philip Morais has made significant contributions to the real estate, hospitality, and sports industries. With a career spanning various renowned companies, his passion for real estate grew over the years through his involvement in the property business in Hong Kong and the Philippines. In the 1980s, Philip founded Shama serviced apartments, later selling his shares to Morgan Stanley. In 2007, Philip established CHI International, a luxury hospitality company managing stylish properties. Philip's love for baseball developed during his childhood. In 1992, Philip made history as one of the first Asian owners in US sports, acquiring a minority stake in the San Francisco Giants. Philip has been an active member of Club Lusitano, a distinguished private members club for Portuguese nationalities and descendants in Hong Kong since the age of 16. He currently serves on its Board of Trustees and General Committee. Furthermore, Philip assumed the role of chairman for the Servicemen's Guides Association in year 2000. This non-profit organization operated Fenwick Pier since 1953, providing assistance to military sailors from all corners of the globe.
Medical Research and Education:
Hon. Dr. Ruchille Sayre Arrocena, MD, Philippines
Dr. Ruchille Sayre Arrocena, MD, is a Fellow of the Philippine Society of Medical Specialist in Government Service and one of the youngest female medical doctors to run a Regional Hospital in the Philippines. Today she is managing successfully the Davao del Norte Hospital â€“ Carmen Zone, where she was taking care of her patients and staff with full engagement through the heavy flooding in 2024. She is also engaging heavily in the education of young doctors in the Philippines.
Award Winners 2023:
Statesmanship and Public Service:
H.E. Stjepan Mesić, Croatia
former President of the Republic of Croatia 2000-2010, former Speaker of the Croatian Parliament 1992 – 1994, last President
of Yugoslavia 1991
Humanitarian Services:
Hon. Dame Tessy Antony de Nassau, Switzerland/Luxembourg
former Princess of Luxembourg, Patron of United Nations Asso-ciation – UK (UNA-UK), UNAids Global Advocate for young women and adolescent girls, decorated army veteran holding the Non-Article 5 NATO Medal and the UN Peace-keeping Medal, Co-founder and President of "Professors Without Borders"
Hon. Marisa Freiermuth-Nicolas, Switzerland
a Philippina working for the benefits and integration of the Philippine Community in Switzerland showing a great enthusiasm in helping disadvantaged groups in the Philippines, Cambodiaand Thailand through personal work and donations. Initiator and Coordinator of the NGO "Vision of Hope" and focusing on help for blind and deaf children and youth.
Cultural and Public Services:
Hon. Dr. Mgr. Antonín Staněk, Ph.D., Czech Republic
former Minister of Culture of the Czech Republic 2018-2019, former Mayor of the City of Olomouc 2014-2018, President of Akademie Koruny svatováclavské
Cultural Achievements:
Hon. Paolo Gambi, Ph.D., Italy
A former successful international journalist Paolo Gambi transformed into a well- known author and artist. As an award-winning multimedia artist he follows his motto "poetry everywhere". He is one of the few artists in the world to perform bodypainting poetry and he was one of the first five poets to mint NFT poetry. He is also the founder of "Rinascimento poetico" (Poetry Renaissance), one of the main Italian networks of poets.
Sustainable Economic and Public Services:
H.E. Sir Reghis M. Romero II, KGCR, Philippines
Special Envoy of the Republic of the Philippines to Japan for business and investments promotion, Founder and Chairman of the Board of the R-II Group of Companies and also a multi-awarded businessman, visionary developmental entrepreneur, industry and civic leader, sportsman, and philanthropist. He is a former Supreme Commander of the Philippine State Order "Knights of Rizal" 2012-2014.
Hon. Prof. Dr. Claus Drexel, Switzerland
Chairman of the Board of Directors and Executive President of the Swiss Chamber of Economics 1996 – today, former Delegate and Expert of the United Nations Economic Commission for Europe 2005 – 2022
Medical Research and Education:
Hon. Prof. Dr. Sir Billy Chan, KGOR, Macau
current the Director of the Center of Excellence in Medical Education, Innovation and Training and Executive Assistant to the Dean of the Faculty of Medicine, at Macau University of Science and Technology. Dr Chan is a regionally acknowledged frontrunner in healthcare simulation training. Over the past 22 years, he has contributed to the arena of medical simulation by introducing skills training programs to advance positive outcomes and reduce errors. He is also Chairman of the Australian Chamber of Commerce in Macao.
Honorary Award for Lifetime Achievement:
H.E. Ioannis Kapodistrias (posthumous), Greece
Ioannis Antonios Kapodístrias, also known as Conte Giovanni Antonio Capo d'Istria, was born 1776 in Corfu and was a great statesman who played a prominent role in Switzerland's institutional reorganisation and in asserting Switzerland's permanent status as a neutral country. Kapodístrias supported the struggle for independence from the Ottoman Empire and was subsequently elected governor of newly independent Greece. The minister plenipotentiary of Tsar Alexander I at the congresses of Vienna and Paris, he gave Switzerland its federal state structure and the policy of neutrality. Switzerland would not be what it is today without his exceptional negotiating skills and his deep attachment to the country.
